messages.title: A strong voice for Chipping Barnet
messages.content: Theresa has been working hard as MP for Chipping Barnet since 2005, and has played a key role in local campaigns eg: supporting the upgrade of the Northern Line; opposing inappropriate developments like Cat Hill and Pinkham Way; saving local Post Offices and securing banking services at Barnet Hospital; securing expanded A&E and maternity services at Barnet Hospital; reopening Brunswick Park Health Centre; bringing BT for faster broadband services in Barnet; working to keep crime-falling in Barnet, eg supporting efforts to combat anti-Semitism.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Creating jobs, and championing our local high streets.
Keeping Barnet's schools among the best in the country.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Defending the green belt and local environment

issues.education: Keeping Barnet's schools among the best in the country.
issues.environment: Defending the green belt and local environment.
issues.health: Securing expanded A&E and maternity services at Barnet Hospital; reopening Brunswick Park Health Centre.

housing.content: Opposing inappropriate developments like Cat Hill and Pinkham Way.

politicalExperience.achievements: Supporting the upgrade of the Northern Line; opposing inappropriate developments; saving local Post Offices and securing banking services; securing expanded A&E and maternity services; reopening Brunswick Park Health Centre; bringing faster broadband services; working to keep crime-falling.

images.caption: Theresa Villiers in a community meeting

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet also states SAY NO to Pinkham Way.
